gurmukhi: jbY rwm dyKY ]mhw rUp lyKY ]rhI nXwie sIsM ]sBY nwr eIsM ]630]
transliteration: Jahia Raam Dekhai|| Mahaa Roop Lekhai|| Rahinyaae Seesan|| Sabhai Naar Eesan||630||
translation: When all of them saw the most beautiful Ram, they bowed their heads and stood before him.630.

gurmukhi: lKYN rUp mohI ]iPrI rwm dyhI ]deI qwih lMkw ]ijmM rwj tMkw ]631]
transliteration: Lakhain Roop Mohee|| Phiriraam Dohee|| Daitaah(i) Lankaa|| Jiman Raaj Tankaa||631||
translation: They were allured to see the beauty of Ram; there was talk about Ram on all the four sides and they all gave Ram the kingdom of Lanka like the tax-payer setting tax with the authority.631.

gurmukhi: kiRpw diRst BIny ]qry nyqR kIny ]JrY bwr AYsy ]mhw myG jYsy ]632]
transliteration: Kridaa Drist Bheene|| Dare Netra Keene|| Jdarai Baar Aise Mahaa Megh Jaise||632||
translation: Ram bowed down his eyes filled with grace; seeing him, the tears of joy flowed down from the eyes of people like the rain falling from the clouds.632.

gurmukhi: CkI pyK nwrI ]srM kwm mwrI ]ibDI rUp rwmM ]mhwN Drm DwmM ]633]
transliteration: Chhakipekh Ndaree|| Saran Kaam Mdaree|| Bidhiroop Raamannd|| Mahaan Dharam Dhaamannd||633||
translation: The woman allured by lust, were delighted to see Ram and they all ended their identity in Ram, the abode of Dharma. 633.

gurmukhi: qjI nwQ pRIqM ]cuBy rwm cIqM ]rhI jor nYxM ]khYN m`d bYxM ]634]
transliteration: Tajinaath Preetan|| Choubhe Raam Cheetan|| Rahijor Nainan|| Kahain Madd Bainan||634||
translation: They all absorbed their minds in Ram, forsaking the love of their husbands and looking towards him resolutely, they began to talk with one another.634.

gurmukhi: sIAw nwQ nIky ]hrYN hwr jIky ]ley jwq ic`qM ]mno coj ib`qM ]635]
transliteration: Seeaa Naath Neeke|| Darain Haar Jeeke|| Lae Jaat Chittan|| Mano Choj Bittan||635||
translation: Ram, the Lord of Sita, is winsome and abductor of the mind; he is stealing the conscious mind like a thief.635.

gurmukhi: sBY pwie lwgo ]pqM dRoh qXwgo ]lgI Dwie pwXM ]sBY nwir AwXM ]636]
transliteration: Sabhai Paae Laago|| Patan Droh Tyaago|| Lagidhaae Paayan|| Sabhai Daar(i) Aayan||636||
translation: All the wives of Ravana were told to abandon the sorrow of their husband and touch the feet of Ram; all of them came forward and fell on his feet.636.

gurmukhi: mhw rUp jwny ]icqM cor mwny ]cuBy ic`qR AYsy ]isqM swie kYsy ]637]
transliteration: Mahaa Roop Jaane|| Chitan Chor Maane|| Choubhe Chittra Aise|| Sitan Saae Kaise||637||
translation: The most beautiful Ram recognized their feelings; he absorbed himself in the minds of all and all of them pursued him like shadow.637.

gurmukhi: lgo hom rUpM ]sBY BUp BUpM ]rMgy rMg nYxM ]Cky dyv gYxM ]638]
transliteration: Lago Hem Roopan|| Sabhai Bhoop Bhoopan|| Rane Ran Nainan|| Chhake Dev Gadnan|| 638||
translation: Ram appeared to them in golden hue and looked like king of all kings; the eyes of all were dyed in his love and the gods were delighted to see him from the sky.638.

gurmukhi: ijnY eyk bwrM ]lKy rwvxwrM ]rhI mohq h√çY kY ]luBI dyK kY kY ]639]
transliteration: Jinai Ek Baaran|| Lakhe Raavanaaran|| Rahimohat Hvai Kai|| Loubhidekh Kai Kai||639
translation: He, who saw Ram even once, she was completely allured.639.

gurmukhi: CkI rUp rwmM ]gey BUl DwmM ]krXo rwm boDM ]mhwN ju`D joDM ]640]
transliteration: Chhakiroop Raamannd|| Gad Bhool Dhaamannd|| Daryo Raam Bodhan|| Mahaan Juddh Jodhan||640||
translation: She forgot the consciousness of all else seeing the beauty of Ram and began to talk to supremely mighty Ram.640.
The speech of Ram addressed to Mandodari :
